metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12957 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: In Xpdf 4.01.01, a buffer over-read could be triggered in FoFiType1C::convertToType1 in fofi/FoFiType1C.cc when the index number is larger than the charset array bounds. It can, for example, be triggered by sending a crafted PDF document to the pdftops tool. It allows an attacker to use a crafted pdf file to cause Denial of Service or an information leak, or possibly have unspecified other impact.

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 ebarretto> since 0.5.12-1 libextractor does not use xpdf anymore. xpdf in Debian uses poppler, which is not affected or fixed

criterions.comment: xpdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
